title: Supreme Court of California
summary: The Supreme Court of California is the highest and final court of appeals in the courts of the U.S. state of California. It resides primarily in San Francisco at the Earl Warren Building,[1] but it regularly holds sessions in Los Angeles and Sacramento. Its decisions are binding on all other California state courts.[2]  Since 1850, the court has issued many influential decisions in a variety of areas including torts, property, civil and constitutional rights, and criminal law.
